results.title: Hiroko Ikoko
results.brief_description: Two little Japanese girls go for a stroll after school to look for beautiful tropical fish which they had been studying and drawing in school. Their search leads them to the pools of a formal garden and to the glass aquariums of street markets. Their parents, who have become anxious over their prolonged absence, go searching and find them. Many glimpses of Tokyo are seen.

results.title: Hirohito: the chrysanthemum throne
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns International, New York Times Productions and Jeremy Murray-Brown
results.brief_description: Examination of the Japanese emperor who, according to Shinto religion, is a direct descendant of the Sun God. Includes footage of Hirohito’s visit to England in 1921 and in the 1960’s; the signing of Japan’s conditions of surrender at the end of the war; and the American occupation after the war. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hiro: the Hiroshima generation
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun, United Nations Television and Fuji-TV
results.brief_description: While interviewing a Japanese student, the cameras show the diversity of Japan’s youth. Shows the clashes and the integration of foreign ideas as the young people struggle for an understanding of Japanese culture 25 years after the bomb.

results.title: Hinkler: the aviator
results.creator_credit: Penny Spence, Nine Network, EBU and John Armstrong
results.brief_description: Bert Hinkler became an Australian hero and is remembered as one of the world’s greatest avaitors. His record-breaking solo flight from England to Australia in 1928 was completed in 15 days reducing the original record by half. People wore Hinkler hats, Hinkler flowers, ate Hinkler puddings and had Hinkler dances as part of the excitement following this achievement. The program recreates scenes and uses archival footage to bring to life not only one of the greatest pioneers in aviation, but also a period of our history.

results.title: Hinduism: an ancient path in the modern world
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Religions of the world”.
The program covers the characteristics and origins of Hinduism, a religion with no single founder and no defined organisation. Hinduism is an ancient path in the modern world with roots that stretch back before the dawn of recorded time. The program also looks at how the caste system operates as part of Indian society.

results.title: Hinduism and the song of God
results.creator_credit: Elda Hartley, Irving Hartley and Hartley Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces the philosophy and religion of Hinduism, emphasizing the concepts of self-realization as expressed in the Bhagavada Gita. Deals with purpose in life the four yogas, the law of karma and the four stages of life.

results.title: Hinduism
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge, David Millar and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great Religions”.
In India, the home of most present adherents, this film traces the history of Hinduism, its evolution over the centuries and its connections to Buddhism and Jainism. Shown are the observances of this faith, its teaching of non-violence, its respect for all living things, how the social order created by it has been modified in the modern world to outlaw the declaration of individuals as “untouchables” and to remove limitations on freedom imposed by caste.

results.title: Hindu family
results.brief_description: Describes the marriage of the daughter of a Brahmin and the customs of old and new India as they are reflected in the daily life of a Hindu family in the village of Atgaum in the province of Gujarat.

results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam investigates the film industry of India. He visits superstars and producers and comes in for some surprises and rural showings.

results.title: Hinchinbrook diary
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Colin Low
results.brief_description: An unobtrusive look at the farming community of Hinchinbrook, Quebec and its timeless lifestyle. The camera moves quietly through the lives of people busy doing what they have always done.
